This is the brand new Lumu app, build for you & your Lumu light meter — from the ground up.

No more shall we divide our features in three separate apps: the Lumu Photo, Lumu Video & Lumu Pinhole apps are now merged into one, redesigned and revamped for a simpler, more intuitive use.

If you have your Lumu light meter you should be seeing 4 different features once you connect it to your iOS device:

Photo Ambient
Cine/Video
Illuminance
Spot Metering

For those of you yet without our light meter, only 'Spot Metering' is available.

Make yourself comfortable, take it out for a spin & make sure to let us know what you think: pr@lu.mu

This version includes the following updates:
- Dark theme for low light conditions
- EV display on illuminance measuring screen 
- Lumu Lite calibration screen
- Ability to edit note text
- Fixed other various issues and bugs

As always, your thoughts and questions are more than welcome. Write to us at pr@lu.mu.

This version includes the following updates:
- lux/footcandle measurements show more decimal places when in low light conditions
- make measurements by pressing volume buttons
- fixed orientation issue when running the app on iPod
- setting for showing 1/10 steps is moved from general settings to each mode
- added flash calibration
- minor visual fixes
- fixed other various issues and bugs

Lumunauts, thanks for all the feedback! We are working hard to bring you all the features you've requested.
As always, your thoughts and questions are more than welcome. Write to us at support@lu.mu.

This version includes the following updates:
- New ND picker makes it possible to stack multiple ND filters
- Ability to switch to different ND notations (can be changed in the mode specific settings)
- Improved flash duration (t0.1) accuracy and also added t0.5 flash time
- Fixed other various issues and bugs

Hey Lumunauts,

This is the new version which includes the following updates:
- Using Lee filters to color correct your lights? Tap the settings icon when in CT mode and select your preferred filter manufacturer.
- Are you as excited to use Lumu Power on the new iPhone as us? This update fixes a few compatibility issues that arise when running the app on iPhone X.
- We fixed a few minor bugs and issues that will make the app work more reliably

As always, any feedback, suggestions or advice can be sent directly to support@lu.mu.

What's new:
- Colors for the correction filters were flipped and are now working correctly (Thank you Noah, for reporting)
- added iPhone X orientation support
- video mode for Spot Metering

We also fixed a few minor bugs that will make the app work more reliably.

As always, any feedback, suggestions or advice can be sent directly to support@lu.mu.

Hey Lumunauts,

Lumu Power is a tool trusted by thousands of photographers and cinematographers around the world enabling them easy and accurate color and ambient measurements. In the spirit of continuous improvement, we are proud to announce that with this update we're making the Lumu Power even more powerful. We're introducing a new firmware update for all Lumu Power devices that will make measuring color temperature even more accurate for some of the more challenging LED and fluorescent light sources.
We achieved this by calculating new calibration matrices for each and every Lumu Power using the sensor data collected during the initial calibration process.

We also fixed a few issues and bugs that will make the app run smoother and crash free.

If you run into any trouble or have a suggestion for the app, let us know at app@lu.mu.

Hey Lumunauts,

This update fixes issues accuracy of measurements when using certain HSS flash units. Spot metering mode has been updated and can now be zoomed with a pinch gesture. Also, a few bugs have been fixed.

Note: Some of our users are reporting loud noise when using headphones while using Lumu app. We're aware of the problem and fixed the issue in previous version 3.2.0. However, if you installed the app before version 3.2.0 and enabled microphone access you are still affected by this issue. To stop the noise when using headphones, please go to iPhone Settings/Privacy/Microphone and disable access to the microphone.
Why did we request access to the microphone in the first place? Our old Lumu (now called Lumu Lite) communicates through the audio port of the iPhone and needs access to the microphone to do so. If you're one of the users who still use the old Lumu, please leave the microphone access enabled as this is the only way the communication is done.

If you run into any troubles or have a suggestion for the app, let us know at app@lu.mu.

Hey Lumunauts,

Thanks for using Lumu Light Meter!

With this update, we bring you a new firmware upgrade (version 5.6) for your Lumu Power with improved flash detection algorithm built from the ground up. 
We also fixed a few issues related to calculating flash parameters and fixed a crash on an iPad when exporting notes.

We hope you enjoy this update, and if you run into any troubles or have a suggestion for the app, let us know at app@lu.mu.
